docna.cdata!:
Honduras - Structural Adjustment Credit :
            Credit 2208 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Honduras - Structural Adjustment
            Credit : Credit 2208 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
Honduras' medium-term growth
            strategy requires measures that will provide a stable
            economic environment to increase domestic savings, and a
            price incentive system which will maximize private sector
            investment in export-oriented and efficient
            import-substitution activities. Maintaining sound monetary,
            exchange rate and fiscal policies under a stabilization
            program will be fundamental to the success of adjustment
            policies required for long-term growth. The major elements
            of such a program will include: (a) a continuing reduction
            of the public sector deficit; (b) a reduction in inflation
            to international levels; (c) full liberalization of domestic
            interest rates; and (d) a freely floating exchange rate
            regime. The principal areas of the medium-term adjustment
            policy agenda include: (a) further reform of public
            enterprises; (b) rationalization of the price incentive
            framework; (c) measures to reduce poverty through social
            sectors reform; and (d) prudent management of the
            country's natural resources and environment.
